alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 06 at 2:08PM PST until January 07 at 10:40PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Newaukum River Near Chehalis affecting Lewis County. .Heavy rains will drive the Newaukum River Near Chehalis above flood stage later this morning. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Newaukum River Near Chehalis. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 205.5 feet, flood waters will inundate most roads and a majority of residential and commercial areas within the region. Swift flood waters will become deep and hazardous, especially near river channels. A stage of 205.5 feet on the Newaukum corresponds to Phase 4 in the Lewis County flood system. Flooding will occur all along the river including headwaters, forks, tributaries, and other streams within and near the Newaukum River Basin. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM PST Thursday the stage was 204.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:45 PM PST Thursday was 204.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 206.1 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 202.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 205.5 feet on 02/08/1996. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 215 AM PST.
